attributes.name: Kernel Module Removal v100.0.1
attributes.description: Kernel modules are pieces of code that can be loaded and unloaded into the kernel upon demand. They extend the functionality of the kernel without the need to reboot the system. This rule identifies attempts to remove a kernel module.
author: Elastic
false_positives: There is usually no reason to remove modules, but some buggy modules require it. These can be exempted by username. Note that some Linux distributions are not built to support the removal of modules at all.
attributes.query:
event.category:process and event.type:(start or process_started) and
  process.args:((rmmod and sudo) or (modprobe and sudo and ("--remove" or "-r")))
